remedy.action: Position the courtyard centrally in the layout to promote balanced air and light flow.
remedy.alternative_action: Shift courtyard slightly towards east with open-to-sky design ensuring adequate ventilation.

technical_notes.reason: Traditional Indian architecture treats the central zone (Brahmasthan) as sacred, promoting harmony and energy circulation.
technical_notes.impact_if_wrong: Improper courtyard placement can result in poor cross-ventilation, dark interiors, and energy imbalance.
technical_notes.construction_constraints: Avoid placing structural columns or tanks in courtyard space. Ensure open-to-sky design or skylights.

north_india.notes: Use semi-open or covered design in extreme weather zones.

south_india.notes: Prominently used in Chettinad and Kerala homes; promote open-to-sky version.

climatic_reason: Central courtyards regulate internal temperature by facilitating stack ventilation and daylight penetration.

engineering_considerations.thermal_flow: Aids in chimney effect by enabling hot air escape vertically.
engineering_considerations.plumbing: Drainage slope must ensure water flow away from surrounding rooms.
engineering_considerations.privacy: Ensure inner courtyard boundaries provide privacy to internal rooms.

zonal_influence_map: Anchors Brahmasthan, influencing symmetry and energy distribution in all directions.
daylighting_guidance: Allows natural daylight from all sides; prefer east-side opening for morning light.

remedy.action: Allocate garden space in the northeast zone to enhance positivity and natural energy flow.
remedy.alternative_action: If space is limited, develop vertical green walls on north or east facades.

technical_notes.reason: Northeast represents the water and growth element in Vastu, and greenery in this zone promotes harmony and wellness.
technical_notes.impact_if_wrong: Placing heavy trees or dense vegetation in southwest can block natural airflow and induce stagnation.
technical_notes.construction_constraints: Avoid planting large trees near foundation; use porous flooring for water absorption and root health.

north_india.notes: Choose plants tolerant to low winter sun; use open lawns.

south_india.notes: Use shade-tolerant native plants and avoid excessive concrete paving.

climatic_reason: Green cover in northeast supports air cooling, reduces glare, and encourages passive ventilation during summer.

engineering_considerations.thermal_flow: Green spaces regulate microclimate, reducing surrounding wall heat gain.
engineering_considerations.plumbing: Incorporate soak pits or rainwater harvesting to manage irrigation runoff.
engineering_considerations.privacy: Use layered planting to create natural buffers without blocking visibility completely.

zonal_influence_map: Enhances positive vibrations and airflow when placed in northeast.
daylighting_guidance: Encourages early morning sunlight absorption, boosting natural light reflection indoors.
source_authority: National Building Code India - Landscaping Addendum
Council of Architecture India - Sustainable Site Practices

remedy.action: Develop the terrace on the west or southwest to maintain structural weight balance.
remedy.alternative_action: If in northeast, use lightweight materials and ensure proper drainage and open sky visibility.

technical_notes.reason: Placing open terraces in heavier zones (like west/southwest) supports energy grounding and stability.
technical_notes.impact_if_wrong: Terrace in northeast with load-bearing structures can suppress positive energy flow and cause imbalance.
technical_notes.construction_constraints: Ensure waterproofing, drainage slope toward north or east, and maintain parapet height between 3–4 feet.

north_india.notes: Avoid excessive solar gain with pergolas or solar panels for dual use.

south_india.notes: Use high albedo coatings to reduce heat absorption.

climatic_reason: Terrace in the west ensures evening sun exposure, helping in natural drying and passive solar gain during winters.

engineering_considerations.thermal_flow: Open west terrace allows radiant heat to dissipate, reducing indoor temperature buildup.
engineering_considerations.plumbing: Proper slope is crucial to prevent water seepage and structural damage.
engineering_considerations.privacy: Install railing height and screening vegetation to balance view and seclusion.

zonal_influence_map: Strengthens grounding zones and supports structural balance when placed in southwest/west.
daylighting_guidance: Terrace facing west provides long daylight hours suitable for solar installations or drying clothes.
source_authority: Indian Green Building Council (IGBC) Terrace Guidelines
National Building Code - Terrace Drainage Section

remedy.action: Place the veranda in the northeast or east direction to welcome morning sunlight and positive energy.
remedy.alternative_action: If unavoidable in southwest, ensure it is elevated, light in construction, and minimally enclosed.

technical_notes.reason: The northeast zone is considered the Ishanya corner, best for open, light, and calming activities.
technical_notes.impact_if_wrong: Verandas in heavy zones like southwest can suppress light and lead to mental stagnation and low energy.
technical_notes.construction_constraints: Maintain open sides, elevation slightly lower than the plinth, and roof overhang to avoid harsh weather.

north_india.notes: Ensure maximum morning light entry; use jali work for partial shading.

south_india.notes: Use sloped tiled roofs to deal with monsoon rain and harsh summer light.

climatic_reason: Eastern placement ensures cool morning sunlight and cross-ventilation for attached interior spaces.

engineering_considerations.thermal_flow: Eastern verandas absorb minimal heat, keeping entry zones pleasant.
engineering_considerations.plumbing: Drainage slope away from main entrance required to avoid water stagnation.
engineering_considerations.privacy: Use semi-permeable screens to balance openness and visual buffering from street.

zonal_influence_map: Supports inflow of prana (life energy) when placed in the northeast quadrant.
daylighting_guidance: Verandas in the northeast or east receive beneficial low-angle sun ideal for morning sitting.
source_authority: Indian Traditional Architecture Handbook – Entry Spaces Section

remedy.action: Relocate the water feature to the northeast corner, aligning with water element principles.
remedy.alternative_action: If relocation is not feasible, reduce its size and install reflective tiles to deflect energy flow.

technical_notes.reason: The northeast is governed by the water element and is considered the source of mental clarity and spiritual growth.
technical_notes.impact_if_wrong: Placing water bodies in fire or heavy zones may lead to financial instability, emotional disturbances, or health issues.
technical_notes.construction_constraints: Ensure foundation waterproofing, avoid placing beneath staircases or toilets, and prevent algae stagnation.

north_india.notes: Prefer shallow fountains; avoid overhanging trees to reduce debris.

south_india.notes: Maintain tiled or stone edge to reduce water seepage due to humidity.

climatic_reason: Northeast placement utilizes early sun to energize water while avoiding excessive evaporation.

engineering_considerations.thermal_flow: Cold water bodies in northeast help regulate ambient heat and support passive cooling.
engineering_considerations.plumbing: Dedicated concealed pipeline with anti-algae UV filters preferred.
engineering_considerations.privacy: Should be visible from main entrance for energy flow but buffered with natural plants for serenity.

zonal_influence_map: Amplifies spiritual and mental clarity zones when placed in northeast.
daylighting_guidance: Position to catch morning light reflection; avoid harsh west-facing glare.
source_authority: Indian Green Building Council – Outdoor Water Design Guide

remedy.action: Relocate or design light shafts to open into the central or northeast zones for optimal light dispersion.
remedy.alternative_action: Introduce reflective light ducts or skylights directed toward central or northeast spaces.

technical_notes.reason: Light shafts promote natural illumination and energy flow; their placement aligns with Vastu’s emphasis on early sunlight entry.
technical_notes.impact_if_wrong: Misplaced shafts can cause overheating, glare, or stagnant energy in lower-priority zones.
technical_notes.construction_constraints: Ensure waterproofing, dust protection grills, and avoid placement above sensitive rooms like toilets or kitchens.

north_india.notes: Allow morning sun with angular glazing for warmth and light.

south_india.notes: Use solar glass or louvers to reduce heat gain due to intense sun.

climatic_reason: Central/northeast shafts provide balanced daylighting with reduced thermal stress, supporting passive cooling.

engineering_considerations.thermal_flow: Acts as a vertical chimney for hot air escape, enhancing indoor air quality.
engineering_considerations.plumbing: Avoid shared walls with plumbing lines to prevent condensation issues.
engineering_considerations.privacy: Design with frosted or angled glazing to prevent direct visual access from higher floors.

zonal_influence_map: Enhances sattvic energy when aligned with Brahmasthan (center) and northeast.
daylighting_guidance: Designed for minimum 2 hours of diffuse sunlight entry between 8am–11am.
source_authority: National Building Code – Natural Lighting Provisions
IIT-R Architecture Research on Light Ventilation Systems in Indian Homes
